p: CDV is another compound that is known to be active in the hamster model after i.v. challenge with Ad5 [ 27]. To assess whether CDV is effective against respiratory challenge with Ad6, we treated i.n.-infected hamsters with the drug. We used the known effective dose (37 mg/kg i.p. followed by 20 mg/kg doses three times weekly), starting the treatment one day before challenge. There were no treatment-related deaths in the study. Hamsters in the Ad6-infected groups were losing weight from the onset of the study ( Figure 6A). CDV treatment significantly mitigated body weight loss ( Figure 6A); however, it was slightly toxic at the dose used, inasmuch as decreased weight gain was seen in the drug-only control group compared to the vehicle-only group.
